Description: A woman's (?) small cap; circular crown, with short sides. Ground made from purple silk velvet cloth. Crown embroidered with a large floral motif: six stems with leaves radiating from an eight-petalled flower. Worked in gold-coloured metal wire over a padded base. A meandering floral and foliage motif, worked in the same manner and materials, decorates the sides. Most of the remaining ground cover in small sequins. Two ornate tassels, made with different forms of metal wire, stitched to centre top. Embroidered on front of cap is the Arabic word for God. (Colour of metal wire different to remainder.) Cap lined with tabby lilac silk cloth (much damaged).
Production ethnic group: Made by: Turk (?: Donations and Purchases Book Volume 8)
